abstract: The bank said that it agreed to sell the long-term asset management business of its mutual fund arm for about $1 billion.
snippet: The bank said that it agreed to sell the long-term asset management business of its mutual fund arm for about $1 billion.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America said Wednesday that it agreed to sell the long-term asset management business of Columbia Management, its mutual fund arm, to Ameriprise Financial for about $1 billion.

headline.main: BofA to Sell Part of Columbia Unit to Ameriprise

abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis has been under pressure since striking an unpopular deal to purchase the investment bank Merrill Lynch.
snippet: Kenneth D. Lewis has been under pressure since striking an unpopular deal to purchase the investment bank Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: Less than a year ago, Bank of America’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, celebrated his daring takeover of Merrill Lynch as the crowning triumph of a long career. On Wednesday, that conquest proved to be his downfall, as he announced his resignation after months of legal and political scrutiny over the star-crossed merger.

headline.main: Bank of America Chief to Depart at Year’s End
headline.print_headline: Ending Rocky Tenure, Chief Is to Leave Bank of America

byline.original: By Louise Story and Eric Dash

abstract: Faint praise for Ken Lewis as he (finally) decides to leave.
snippet: Faint praise for Ken Lewis as he (finally) decides to leave.
lead_paragraph: Ken Lewis is retiring as the boss of Bank of America, my colleagues Eric Dash and Louise Story report.
